tn.ref: from the end of the Salt Sea, from the bay that faces to the south
tn.text: "from the bay that faces south at the end of the Salt Sea." These two phrases refer to the same location. The second phrase clarifies the point at which the southern border begins.
smaller part of the sea that extends into the land
"that turns toward the south"
"The border of the land belonging to the tribe of Judah"

tn.ref: the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman and Talmai, descendants of Anak
tn.text: These names represent clans of people who were descendants of Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai. The words "sons" and "descendants" in this context mean the same thing. AT: "the three clans, Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, who were descendants of Anak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.text: "He went up from there to fight against"

tn.ref: she urged him to ask her father for a field
tn.text: This can be translated as direct speech. AT: "she urged him, 'Ask my father to give me a field'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: the upper springs and lower springs
tn.text: The words "upper" and "lower" likely refer to the geographical altitude of the water springs.

tn.ref: This was the inheritance of the tribe of Judah
tn.text: The land that the tribe of Judah received is spoken of as if it were an inheritance that they received as a permanent possession. AT: "This was the land that the tribe of Judah received as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which Joshua gave to their clans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
